concept.title: Requirements for Web Service Calls from

section.p: For the provisioning of application instances and for integrating external process control or PSP systems, calls other Web services which can be addressed by HTTPS. In this scenario, is the Web service client while the other entity is the HTTPS server. The following requirements must be fulfilled to establish a connection to the server:

ul.li: The server must present a valid certificate: The CN (common name) must correspond to the server's domain name and it must be valid at the time of calling.

The client () must trust the server's certificate. To this end, the server's certificate must have been imported into the client's truststore, or the client's truststore must contain a root certificate with a valid signing chain to the certificate presented by the server.
